--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, laur=
ie@... wrote:
>
> 
> I do not have an ovilus or a puck - I was going to get=
 one, but I participated in many sessions alternating puck, ovilus, and rad=
io devices.
> 
> 
> 
> Although at times we would get relevant responses on=
 the puck and ovilus, more often than not it would be confusing, irrelevant=
, and disjointed.
> 
> 
> We would invariably return to the the radios and =
have much better results, so at this time I have decided to concentrate my =
efforts on radios and a couple of other methods and areas I am still resear=
ching.
> 
> 
> 
> I always encourage people to do their own research, thoug=
h. If you want to, go for it!
> 
> Just let us know what happens.
> The res=
ults I talked about were not meant to discourage you, just to tell you what=
 we experienced. Maybe some people do better with the puck and ovilus. Not =
everyone is meant to do everything.
> 
> 
> 
> Laurie
>

> I personally have not used this device, but a close friend and fel=
low investigator just purchased one. She has used it only a few times but t=
he results were encourageing. On her first recorded session, when asking "w=
hy are you here", the reply that she recieved certainly seemed relevant. Th=
e Ovilus stated " fell running down stairs, broken neck". Another interesti=
ng response from the recording was in reply to the question "who are you?" =
The response from the Ovilus was "ghost". However, she also recieved respon=
ses that did not seem relevant to the questions she was asking at the time.=
 She sends me all of her recordings for review so I will keep you posted on=
 the results. Personally, I can't wait to get my hands on one to try it out=
 for myself.
